column4: anyone here having a good experience in OOo? Anyone can please help me?
I'm trying to copy an image from a webpage
I use OOo almost EVERY DAY! :) :)
but the image is not displaying
only a link to the image
save it to your computer then import it
the problem is when ur reading ur docs offline image doesn't appear
but its not convenient saving the image and importing
because the browser U R using doesn't copy the image data, just the link to it
no offense meant - but in MS Word it does
for example, i got a long, and many images documents from the net - its very convenient if i can simply copy-all and then paste it in OOo Writer

it's perfectly convenient -- your m$ experience has made you lazy -- what logical reason does it serve to *copy* the data (in this case an image file but the concept applies to any file format) and store it inside the Open Office writer file??

what happens when you want to use that same picture in a spreadsheet -- you would once again *copy* the data... in other words a copy of a copy --- it started as a low quality image in the first place (assuming JPEG) -- now I know we're not talking about losing data in this case but you wouldn't make a copy of a copy of a picture unless you were desperate...
well i got ur point - but again the time i need to do all those manual thing is not practical. if i can copy and paste it in two steps, that would be perfect.
how about u have for example 100 images in 1 web page? how long u gonna do the save and import thing?
there are tools that make that easy... wget in this case (type "man wget" at the command prompt)
